quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Hospital and Doctor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, drama. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who played Father McCabe, the founder of the hospital on the show St. Elsewhere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Herrmann

questions.question: Which doctor from the TV series St. Elsewhere had liver cancer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Auslander

questions.question: Which doctor in the drama series St. Elsewhere was played by Ed Flanders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Westphal

questions.question: The show St. Elsewhere won a total of 9 Emmys. Who won the most Emmys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Daniels

questions.question: Which famous actor played Dr. Chandler on St. Elsewhere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denzel Washington

questions.question: On the show St. Elsewhere, the hospital PA often mentioned the names of doctors from other  TV shows.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the real name of the saint for which the hospital in St. Elsewhere is named?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Eligius

questions.question: Bruce Paltrow and mark Tinker directed the show St. Elsewhere for the first two years of its run.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On the show St. Elsewhere, who plays Jack Morrison, the doctor who falsified his records to be  accepted by the hospital?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Morse

questions.question: On the TV show The King of Queens, Dougs parents live in Florida.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was Dougs sisters name on the sitcom The King of Queens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephanie

questions.question: What was Carries fathers name on The King of Queens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arthur

questions.question: Which company produced the show St. Elsewhere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MTM

questions.question: Which doctor was Chief of Surgery on the show St. Elsewhere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Craig

questions.question: What was Carries job on the TV sitcom The King of Queens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: legal secretary

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Episode and Dick Van Dyke
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, daniels, s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: William Daniels and Bonnie Bartlett each won an Emmy in 1986 for their performance on the show St. Elsewhere. What was unusual about  that?

options.text: They played husband and wife and were really husband and wife.
They never appeared in the same scene together.
It was the first and only Emmy for each of them.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They played husband and wife and were really husband and wife.

questions.question: This guest star played a reverend in episode #31of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “A Word a Day.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Shallert

questions.question: What year did Comedy Centrals South Park premier?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1997

questions.question: Which singer played one of Sally’s beaus in episode #38 of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “Like a Sister”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vic Damone

questions.question: What guest star is featured in episode #57 of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “Racy Tracy Rattigan”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Dawson

questions.question: In episode #53 of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “Give Me Your Walls,” this guest star played a house painter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vito Scotti

questions.question: Which of the following is a spin-off of The Daily Show and premeired in 2005?

options.text: The Showbiz Show with David Spade

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Colbert Report

questions.question: Who were the 3 comics involved in Blue Collar TV?

options.text: Jeff Foxworthy, Ron White, Larry the Cable Guy
Jeff Foxworthy, Ron White, Bill Engvall
Bill Engvall, Jeff Foxworthy, Larry the Cable Guy
Bill Engvall, Ron White, Larry the Cable Guy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Engvall, Jeff Foxworthy, Larry the Cable Guy

questions.question: In episode #24 of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “The Twizzle,” this guest star played the part of Randy Twizzle’s father.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Albertson

questions.question: This guest star first showed up on The Dick Van Dyke Show in a recurring role in episode 4, titled “Sally and the Lab Technician.”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jamie Farr

questions.question: Which statement regarding the show St. Elsewhere is true?

options.text: Forest Whitakers role was eventually replaced by David Cross role.
Several characters from Lou Grant  appear in St. Elsewhere.
Dr. Chandler eventually marries a nurse.
In real life, the shows production company was sued by Humana.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In real life, the shows production company was sued by Humana.

questions.question: What happens in the final episode of the show St. Elsewhere?

options.text: We find out the whole show was a dream in Tommys head.
All the major doctors are fired because of a law suit.
The Forest Whitaker character is murdered in the ER.
The hospital must file for bankruptcy.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We find out the whole show was a dream in Tommys head.

questions.question: What comic had his own sketch series on Comedy Central from 2003-2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Chappelle

questions.question: How many Emmys did Alfrie Woodard win for St. Elsewere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0

questions.question: In episode #13 of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “Empress Carlotta’s Necklace,” this guest star played Mels cousin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gavin MacLeod

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Quantum Leap and Sam
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, al. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the sci-fi TV series Quantum Leap, Sam is married in his real life and doesnt recall his wife while leaping.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what year was Quantum Leaps pilot episode aired?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1989

questions.question: In an episode of Quantum Leap, Sam was this notorious killer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lee Harvey Oswald

questions.question: Who is credited with creating 60 Minutes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Hewitt

questions.question: Which one of Sams brothers went to Vietnam on the TV show Quantum Leap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom

questions.question: Quantum Leap character Al was a Rear Admiral in the U.S. Navy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of the computer that assists Sam and Al on the TV show Quantum Leap.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ziggy

questions.question: Quantum Leap character Sam never leaps into which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A U.S. President

questions.question: One episode of Quantum Leap focuses on Al being a P.O.W.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Richard Salant, former CBS President of the News Division, supported the concept for the show 60 Minutes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This actor played Big Max Calvada in the self-titled episode of The Dick Van Dyke Show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sheldon Leonard

questions.question: Who plays the ex-policeman in the card game in episode #81of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “A Nice Friendly Game of Cards”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Platt

questions.question: On the TV show Quantum Leap, Sam can travel through time from the year 0 to infinity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Sam Beckett, the protagonist of the TV series Quantum Leap, was from this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indiana

questions.question: Who played Uncle George in episode #68 of The Dick Van Dyke Show, titled “Uncle George”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denver Pyle

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Minutes and Reporter
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, reporters, report. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the original reporters for 60 Minutes, who retired in 2006, became famous for his confrontational style of interviewing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Wallace

questions.question: The creator of the show 60 Minutes describes its format as a blend of higher Murrow and lower  Murrow. What does that mean?

options.text: The show presents all points of  view.
The show originally featured reporters from several  Edward R. Murrow shows.
The show combines investigative stories with profiles of famous people .
The show will constantly go for the throat  when the stories could give high ratings.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The show combines investigative stories with profiles of famous people .

questions.question: What big change regarding the show 60 Minutesoccurred in October 29, 2006?

options.text: An extra story was added each week.
The opening sequence went from a black background to a white background.
Bill Bradley took over as the lead reporter.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The opening sequence went from a black background to a white background.

questions.question: What best describes the format of the show 60 Minutes?

options.text: Two news stories, one two-minute Op-Ed piece
Three news stories, no graphics, one short Op-Ed piece
Four news stories, one ten-minute Op-Ed piece
Varying number of stories and one short Op-Ed piece

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three news stories, no graphics, one short Op-Ed piece

questions.question: Which 60 Minutes reporter earned an Emmy for his report on the AIDS epidemic in Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Bradley

questions.question: Who replaced Harry  Reasoner on the show 60 Minutes in 1969?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morley Safer

questions.question: Which statement regarding the show 60 Minutes is true?

options.text: The show began as a semi-weekly hour show on CBS on 9/ 24 /1968.
The show began as a weekly hour show on CBS on 9/ 24 /1968.
The show began as a monthly show on CBS on 9 /24 /1971.
The show began as a weekly hour show on CBS on 9 /24 /1971.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The show began as a semi-weekly hour show on CBS on 9/ 24 /1968.

questions.question: Segments on Saturday Night Live aped the 60 Minutes debates. Who were the comics who portrayed the debaters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan Akroyd and Jane Curtain

questions.question: Which reporter joined 60 Minutes, after Dan Rather left the show to replace Walter Cronkite as the CBS news anchor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Bradley

questions.question: Which reporter for 60 Minutes was born in 1931 in Toronto?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morley Safer

questions.question: Which 60 Minutes reporter was famous for his hard-hitting reporting of Vietnam atrocities, the troubles in Northern Ireland, and in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morley Safer

questions.question: In 1996 the debate segment of the show 60 Minutes had a new name. What was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clinton / Dole

questions.question: From 1971 to 1979 60 Minutes featured a debate segment called what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Point /Counterpoint

questions.question: Which former 60 Minutes reporter was ABC co-anchor with Barbara Walters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Reasoner

questions.question: Who was the first female reporter on the show 60 Minutes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diane Sawyer

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Minutes and Reporter
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, show, movie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Futurama parodies the show 60 Minutes in an episode called Sixty Minutes: After Dark.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: An expose by the show 60 Minutes resulted in the filming of the movie The Insider. What company was involved?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brown and Williamson

questions.question: What was the last year Newhart aired?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1990

questions.question: The show 60 Minutes was parodied in an episode of The Simpsons which was a spoof of The Shining.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1991, 60 Minutes did a piece on Werner Erhard. Who was he?

options.text: The leader of the Scientology movement
The founder of the EST movement
The leader of the Aryan nation

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The founder of the EST movement

questions.question: Which of these was never a 60 Minutes reporter?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill OReilly

questions.question: Which reporter died in November, 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Bradley

questions.question: The show 60 Minutes was a top ten show for how many seasons in a row, starting in 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 23

questions.question: Which 60 Minutes reporter has won numerous Emmy Awards, including the lifetime achievement Emmy, Overseas Press Awards, Peabody Awards, the Robert F. Kennedy Journalism Award for the report ,“School for the Homeless”, and a Paul White Award in journalism?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morley Safer

questions.question: The show 60 Minutes once featured this Senator who may have misused state funds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al DAmato

questions.question: In 1999, CBS had a second edition of the show 60 Minutes, called what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 60 Minutes II

questions.question: What was the last name of inn owner Dick, played by Bob Newhart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Loudon

questions.question: In the movie Drop Dead Gorgeous, the character played by Kirsten Dunst wants to win a beauty pageant and be a reporter just like whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diane Sawyer

questions.question: In 1982, the show 60 Minutes was forced to issue a retraction of a Mike Wallace piece. Who was the person involved in the smear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General William Westmoreland

questions.question: In 1986, it was reported on the show 60 Minutes that a certain car accelerated while in park. What car was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Audi

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Newhart and Series
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, cafe, frances. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the Dragon Ball Z series the evil tyrant Dragon Jr. has a team of henchmen, named the Spice Boys. Which of these is not a member of the team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ketchup

questions.question: What was the name of the inns eccentric handyman on the Newhart show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Utley

questions.question: On the Newhart show, what are the two other occupations Dick has in addition to owning and operating the inn?

options.text: tour guide and TV show host

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: author and TV show host

questions.question: What is the name of the TV show Dick hosts in the TV series Newhart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vermont Today

questions.question: What type of books does Dick write on the Newhart show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: how-to books

questions.question: This actress, born Mary Frances Luecke, played Dicks wife Joanna on the TV show Newhart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Frann

questions.question: What is the source of the Saiyans power in the Dragon Ball Z series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their reserve of Ki energy

questions.question: Which Saiyan warrior is Gokus father in the Dragon Ball series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bardock

questions.question: What is the name of Gokus powerful beam blast attack in Dragon Ball Z?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: kamehameha

questions.question: The fictional Minuteman Cafe, located next door to the inn, was originally owned by Kirk Devane, but later in the Newhart series it was owned by three brothers. What were their names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Larry, Darryl and Darryl

questions.question: In the Dragon Ball Z series, Saiyans lose their power if they happen to lose what part of their body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: tail

questions.question: Goku, the main character of the Dragon Ball series, had how many kids?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: What is the name of the inn Dick and Joanna own and operate on the Newhart show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stratford

questions.question: What was the name of the spoiled, shallow maid featured on the Newhart show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephanie Vanderkellen

questions.question: Who created the powerful dragon balls in the Dragon Balls series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guru
